detaileddescription.para: Buffer can be used as a shader binding table. Should not be used directly, use get_shader_binding_table_buffer_properties to calculate all properties, including create flags.

briefdescription.para: Buffer is used as scratch space for RT structure builds.

enumvalue.name: WRITEMASK_RED
enumvalue.initializer: = WRITEMASK_RED0 | WRITEMASK_RED1 | WRITEMASK_RED2 | WRITEMASK_RED3 | WRITEMASK_RED4 | WRITEMASK_RED5 | WRITEMASK_RED6 | WRITEMASK_RED7

enumvalue.name: WRITEMASK_GREEN
enumvalue.initializer: = WRITEMASK_GREEN0 | WRITEMASK_GREEN1 | WRITEMASK_GREEN2 | WRITEMASK_GREEN3 | WRITEMASK_GREEN4 | WRITEMASK_GREEN5 | WRITEMASK_GREEN6 | WRITEMASK_GREEN7

enumvalue.name: WRITEMASK_BLUE
enumvalue.initializer: = WRITEMASK_BLUE0 | WRITEMASK_BLUE1 | WRITEMASK_BLUE2 | WRITEMASK_BLUE3 | WRITEMASK_BLUE4 | WRITEMASK_BLUE5 | WRITEMASK_BLUE6 | WRITEMASK_BLUE7

enumvalue.name: WRITEMASK_ALPHA
enumvalue.initializer: = WRITEMASK_ALPHA0 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA1 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA2 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA3 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA4 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA5 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA6 | WRITEMASK_ALPHA7

detaileddescription.para: Use a value from the 0th sample. If depth resolve is supported, this is generally supported too.
Use the average value from all samples. Not supported on iOS, rarely supported on Android Vulkan.
Use the smallest value from all samples. Supported on iOS, rarely supported on Android Vulkan.
Same as DEPTH_RESOLVE_MODE_MIN, but the largest value is used instead.
This enum defines bits signalling supported depth resolve modes. Depth resolve is a functionality supported by some GAPIs which allows to resolve MSAA depth into a single sampled one.
In the context of Vulkan, we do additional checks to determine supported depth resolve modes. Therefore, fewer modes than the driver returns can be reported.
Dagor specific ID of the currently used GPU's vendor.

briefdescription.para: selects rate value from previous stage
selects min of previous and this stage
selects max of previous and this stage
adds values of previous and this stage and clamps it to max possible value
Combiners for VRS for vertex stage and pixel shader state.

detaileddescription.para:
Should the device support DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasVariableRateShadingCombiners, then each combiner can be used for any stage in any combination. When DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasVariableRateShadingCombiners is not supported then the following restrictions apply:
vertex state can only be PASSTHROUGH
if DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasVariableRateShadingShaderOutput is supported then vertex state can additionally be OVERRIDE
pixel state can only be PASSTHROUGH
if DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasVariableRateShadingTexture is supported then pixel state can additionally be OVERRIDE

enumvalue.name: RB_RO_GENERIC_READ_BUFFER
enumvalue.initializer: = RB_RO_SRV | RB_RO_CONSTANT_BUFFER | RB_RO_VERTEX_BUFFER | RB_RO_INDEX_BUFFER | RB_RO_COPY_SOURCE | RB_RO_RAYTRACE_ACCELERATION_BUILD_SOURCE

detaileddescription.para: Count of the available vendors in GpuVendor enum.
